meanings.definition: To deprive of a right or privilege
meanings.sent1: The new law will disentitle some people from voting.
meanings.sent2: The judge's ruling will disentitle the defendant from receiving any compensation.
meanings.sent3: Being late will disentitle you from participating in the game.
meanings.sent4: His dishonest actions disentitled him from the trust of his friends.
meanings.sent5: Failure to follow the rules will disentitle you from the rewards.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from having a right or claim
meanings.sent1: The strict policy may disentitle certain individuals from entering the premises.
meanings.sent2: The fine print in the contract could disentitle you from making a claim.
meanings.sent3: His constant excuses disentitle him from any sympathy from others.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events disentitled her from her expected inheritance.
meanings.sent5: The lack of evidence may disentitle the plaintiff from winning the case.
